alert.note: Alert for Bayamon; Carolina; Catano; Dorado; Guaynabo; San Juan; Toa Alta; Toa Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 3:45PM ADT until September 18 at 7:15PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM AST THIS EVENING FOR BAYAMON, CAROLINA, CATANO, DORADO, GUAYNABO, SAN JUAN, TOA ALTA AND TOA BAJA COUNTIES... At 245 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 5 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly, and the flash flood warning will likely be extended. River sensors indicate that Rio Grande de Bayamon in Bayamon is out of its banks. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... San Juan, Guaynabo, Bayamon, Catano, Sabana Seca, Toa Alta, Trujillo Alto, Toa Baja, Carolina, Dorado, Corozal, Vega Alta, Levittown, Candelaria, Pajaros, Candelaria Arenas, Ingenio, Campanilla, San Jose and Galateo. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.

area.areaDesc: Bayamon; Carolina; Catano; Dorado; Guaynabo; San Juan; Toa Alta; Toa Baja
